headline: Blue Owl Offered a Way Out to Private Credit Investors. Why It’s a Tough Sell.
summary: Blue Owl has been trying to simplify its large roster of debt funds, which are known as business development companies.  Early this month, it resolved to merge one of its nontraded BDCs into the firm’s big publicly traded BDC.  Since the loans in the $17 billion public  Blue Owl Capital Corp.  are pretty much the same those held in the $1.7 billion nontraded Blue Owl Capital Corp. II, the exchange was set at the net asset values of each fund.
